N1.label: Energy Transition Winner
N1.description: Energy Transition Winner — Sustainability Revenue Grows to 60%+
N1.plain_english: Worley is positioning as the go-to engineering partner for the energy transition with sustainability revenue growing rapidly.
N1.what_to_watch: Sustainability revenue mix, new contract wins in hydrogen/CCS/offshore wind, IRA and EU Green Deal funding.
N1.upside: Material re-rating if sustainability revenue exceeds 60% and margins converge with traditional energy.
N1.risk_plain: If project delays persist and sustainability margins remain structurally lower, growth thesis weakens.

N2.label: Traditional Energy Cash Cow
N2.description: Traditional Energy Cash Cow — LNG and Upstream Sustain
N2.plain_english: Traditional energy still generates ~50% of revenue at higher margins, providing the cash flow foundation.
N2.what_to_watch: LNG investment cycle, Middle East upstream capex, oil price trajectory.
N2.upside: If traditional energy spending sustains, segment provides stable cash flow and higher margins.
N2.risk_plain: If oil prices collapse below US$60/bbl, traditional energy capex would be cut sharply.

N3.label: Margin Pressure
N3.description: Margin Pressure — Integration Drag and Fixed-Price Exposure
N3.plain_english: EBITA margin remains below the 8-9% target due to legacy fixed-price contracts and lower sustainability margins.
N3.what_to_watch: Quarterly EBITA margin, fixed-price contract run-off, sustainability vs traditional margin gap.
N3.risk_plain: If margins cannot reach 8%+ by FY26, the market will question management execution credibility.

N4.label: Cyclical Downturn
N4.plain_english: A global recession triggers simultaneous cuts in both traditional and sustainability energy capex.
N4.what_to_watch: Global recession indicators, oil price, government clean energy subsidy policies, backlog cancellations.
N4.risk_plain: In past downturns revenue fell 20-30% and margins compressed to near-zero; elevated leverage amplifies risk.

big_picture: Worley Limited (ASX: WOR) — coverage initiated. Full analysis pending.

hypotheses.title: Energy Transition Winner — Sustainability Revenue Grows to 60%+
Traditional Energy Cash Cow — LNG and Upstream Sustain
Margin Pressure — Integration Drag and Fixed-Price Exposure

crossover.description: 50-day MA crossed below 200-day MA in July 2025, confirming downtrend. Price recently reclaimed 50-day MA, potential early bottoming signal.

trend.structure: Sharp downtrend from $17.50 peak (Apr 2025) to $10.00 low (Dec 2025), followed by base-building between $11.50-$13.50. Lower highs sequence may be breaking with recent strength above $12.80. Early bottoming signals present.

support.method: Double bottom formation + volume support cluster

priorSpikes.context: FY24 results — margin miss triggered 12% sell-off on heavy volume
Insider buying disclosed — CEO/CFO purchases sparked 15% rally from $10.00 low

inflectionPoints.event: FY24 results — margin miss, stock fell 12%
Capital Markets Day — mixed reception, range-bound
Capitulation low — insider buying sparked recovery rally
